titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Singleton Mosby U.S. Civil War scrapbook, 1886-1887 MS 153

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: John Singleton Mosby U.S. Civil War scrapbook
did.abstract: The collection consists of a scrapbook of newspaper clippings by and about J.S. Mosby, a Confederate soldier, that detail his adventures in the Confederate cavalry. Also included are unfavorable clippings from local newspapers on the occasion of his visit to New England in 1886.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Singleton Mosby (1833-1916), the Confederate Partisan Ranger, was commissioned in the Virginia state forces in 1861. When that state succeeded he became a private in the 1st Virginia cavalry and fought at 1st Bull Run. In 1863 he was given permission to organize his Partisan Rangers and engage in guerilla warfare. He was promoted to Colonel on December 7, 1864. Mosby disbanded his Rangers on April 20, 1865, and returned to law practice. He later became involved in Reconstruction politics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a scrapbook of newspaper clippings by and about J.S. Mosby, a Confederate soldier, that detail his adventures in the Confederate cavalry. Also included are unfavorable clippings from local newspapers on the occasion of his visit to New England in 1886.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was a gift of Edward Howard Brigham to the Massachusetts Historical Society in 1915, and purchased from the Society in 1972.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Singleton Mosby Scrapbook, 1886-1887 Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the Mosby Scrapbook must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook, 1 bound volume of pasted in newspaper clippings
